clinical_study.brief_title: Optimizing Adherence and Glycemia in Youth With New Insulin-dependent Diabetes Mellitus (IDDM)
clinical_study.official_title: Optimizing Adherence and Glycemia in Youth With New IDDM

collaborator.agency: National Institute of Diabetes and Digestive and Kidney Diseases (NIDDK)

brief_summary.textblock: This 2-year randomized, controlled trial examined the impact of a clinic-based, family teamwork intervention on glycemic control in youth with recently diagnosed type 1 diabetes.

primary_outcome.measure: Glycemic control, assessed by hemoglobin A1c
primary_outcome.description: Change in A1c from baseline to 2 years, measured every 3 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Youth quality of life, measured using the youth PedsQL survey and the parent-proxy PedsQL survey
secondary_outcome.description: Measured at baseline, 1 year, and 2 years

secondary_outcome.measure: Diabetes-specific family conflict, measured using the Diabetes Family Conflict survey (youth and parent versions)
secondary_outcome.description: Measured at baseline, 1 year, and 2 years

secondary_outcome.measure: Parent involvement in diabetes management tasks, measured using the Diabetes Family Responsibility Questionnaire (youth and parent versions)
secondary_outcome.description: Measured at baseline, 1 year, and 2 years

arm_group.description: Families randomized to the Teamwork Group received the behavioral family teamwork intervention.
Families in the Standard Care group received standard diabetes care and equal attention from study staff between visits to schedule appointments and encourage regular diabetes follow-up care.

intervention.description: Families in the teamwork group received quarterly psychoeducational interventions at regular clinic visits, focusing on promoting family teamwork and reducing diabetes-specific family conflict and diabetes burnout.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 8 to 17 years old
- Duration of type 1 diabetes between 2 months and 6 years
- Residence in New England or New York
- At least 1 outpatient visit in the past year
Exclusion Criteria:
- Major co-morbid psychiatric or medical illness in youth
- Diagnosis of an active major psychiatric disorder in either parent
- Diagnosis of a life-threatening medical illness in either parent
